page.title: 18LIFE STYLE
page.content: Some local people were interviewed to obtain their view of living in the area and how it had changed over time. Generally, it was felt the area was increasingly attractive because it was pleasant, had good communications, education and leisure facilities. The result was many new houses and high prices. Traffic had increased enormously in the area, especially at rush hour times. Villages had become larger and were losing their character. However, most people were happy in the area, most wives worked, at least part-time, and many of them had professional jobs.
